workflow.name: AI prompt hub (Notion + ChatGPT): auto-find the right prompt with embeddings
workflow.description:
## Overview

Build your own **AI Prompt Hub** inside n8n.  
This template lets ChatGPT automatically **search your saved prompts in Notion using semantic embeddings** from HuggingFace. Each time a user sends a message, the workflow finds the most relevant prompt based on meaning - not keywords.

Perfect for developers who maintain dozens of prompts and want ChatGPT to pick the right one automatically.

## Key Features

- üîç **Semantic Prompt Search** - Finds the best prompt using HuggingFace embeddings  
- üß† **AI Agent Integration** - ChatGPT automatically calls the prompt-search workflow  
- üìö **Notion Prompt Database** - Store unlimited prompts with auto-generated embeddings  
- ‚ö° **Automatic Embedding Sync** - Regenerates vectors when prompts change  

This template is ideal for:
- AI automations  
- Prompt engineering  
- DevOps and backend engineers who reuse prompts  
- Teams managing large prompt libraries  

## How it works

1. The user sends any message to the ChatGPT interface  
2. The n8n AI Agent calls a sub-workflow that performs **semantic search** in Notion  
3. HuggingFace converts both the message and saved prompts into vector embeddings  
4. The workflow returns the most similar prompt, which ChatGPT can use automatically  

## Setup Instructions (15‚Äì20 minutes)

1. Import this template into your n8n instance  
2. Set credentials for **Notion**, **OpenAI**, and **HuggingFace**  
3. Create a Notion database with:  
   - `Prompt` (Text)  
   - `Embeddings` (Text)  
   - `Checksum` (Text)  
4. Paste your Notion database ID in:  
   - ‚ÄúGet All Prompts‚Äù  
   - ‚ÄúOn Page Update‚Äù  
   - ‚ÄúOn Page Create‚Äù  
   - ‚ÄúGet All Prompts for Search‚Äù  
5. Enable the workflow and open the URL from ‚ÄúWhen chat message received‚Äù to start chatting  
6. Type any request - the system will search for a matching prompt automatically  

## Documentation & Demo

Full documentation and examples:  
https://github.com/YahorDubrouski/ai-planner/blob/main/documentation/prompt-hub/README.md

parameters.initialMessages:
Hi there! üëã
My name is JARVIS. How can I assist you today?

options.systemMessage:
You are an assistant connected to a Prompt Hub.

For every user message, follow this workflow:

1. **Always first** call the tool `Search a Prompt` with the entire user message as `query`.
2. If the tool returns a matching prompt (`notFound = false`):
   - Do NOT answer the user yet.
   - Show the found prompt to the user.
   - Ask:  
     **"I found a saved prompt that matches your request. Do you want to use it?"**
   - Then wait for the user's confirmation.
3. If the tool returns no prompt (`notFound = true`):
   - Continue normally and answer the user's request with the model.
   - Do not call the tool again until the next user message.

Never skip the prompt search step. The first step for **every** user message is always a call to `Search a Prompt`.

parameters.description:
Find the most relevant saved prompt for the user‚Äôs message.

Use this tool **for every user message**, even if the user does not explicitly ask to search for prompts.

Input: a natural language query (the user message).

Output:
- the best matching saved prompt,
- a similarity score,
- and a `notFound` flag.

Always call this tool first before generating any answer.

value.query: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('query', `User‚Äôs request for which to find a saved prompt.`, 'string') }}

parameters.content:
## Chat Interface

ChatGPT interface that searches for prompts on each message. If found, suggests the prompt; otherwise responds normally.

## Prompt Finder

Searches Notion prompts using semantic similarity. Compares user message embeddings with saved prompt embeddings.

# GPT-Integrated Prompt Hub

## How it works

This workflow automatically searches your saved prompts in Notion when you chat with ChatGPT. When you send any message, the AI agent first searches your Notion database using semantic similarity. It converts both your message and saved prompts into numerical vectors (embeddings) using HuggingFace, then compares them to find the most similar match. If a matching prompt is found, it suggests it to you. If not, it responds normally.

The workflow has three main parts:
1. **Embeddings Generator** - Automatically creates embeddings when you add/update prompts in Notion, or regenerates all embeddings via webhook trigger
2. **Chat Interface** - The ChatGPT interface that triggers prompt search on each message
3. **Prompt Finder** - Compares your message with saved prompts to find the best match

## Setup steps

1. Import this workflow and configure credentials: OpenAI, HuggingFace, and Notion
2. Create a Notion database with columns: Prompt (Text), Embeddings (Text), Checksum (Text)
3. Set your Notion Database ID in these nodes: "Get All Prompts", "On Page Update", "On Page Create", "Get All Prompts for search"
4. Activate the workflow, open the URL from the "When chat message received" node, and start chatting

## Embeddings Generator

Generates embeddings for new/updated prompts. Triggers: Notion page create/update or manual sync webhook to update all prompts' embeddings.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
